TopicTitle: Emmanuel Katto Uganda | How KSP2 Work?

Articles.Content: Hello everyone, myself Emmanuel Katto from Uganda. I need to know what is KSP2 and how it works....

Welcome to the forum @Emmanuel Katto! 

Kerbal Space Program 2 is a space flight simulator, the idea is you build craft from parts and then fly them through a solar system with some similarities to our own or you can make things like trains, submarines or aircraft to fly on the homeworld. If you have no knowledge of orbital mechanics as I did before I started playing, you will learn a lot about how real spacecraft actually operate, in a simplified way.

Also your question has been moved from KSP 2 discussion to Welcome Aboard.
Welcome @Emmanuel Katto!

Welcome to the forum!

 

KSP2 is a game about building rockets that can explore the solar system. It is similar to KSP1 but with better graphics overall.

Welcome newbie!

KSP2 is a successor to KSP1 in which you can build rockets/planes and fly them. It has better graphics than the first game but less content in its current state.

49 minutes ago, Alpha_star said:

Welcome newbie!

KSP2 is a successor to KSP1 in which you can build rockets/planes and fly them. It has better graphics than the first game but less content in its current state.

sandbox wise it doesn’t exactly have less content than KSP1 since it has all the celestials, but there are some parts missing elsewhere.

 

The main thing is that KSP2 is very buggy, so i suggest to get KSP1 first as it’s less expensive, requires less system requirements, has little bugs, has a lot of mods to make the game much better (highly recommended) and you never know when KSP2 will actually work properly.

17 hours ago, RevanX_LSR said:

sandbox wise it doesn’t exactly have less content than KSP1 since it has all the celestials, but there are some parts missing elsewhere.

 

The main thing is that KSP2 is very buggy, so i suggest to get KSP1 first as it’s less expensive, requires less system requirements, has little bugs, has a lot of mods to make the game much better (highly recommended) and you never know when KSP2 will actually work properly.

I second this. At its current state, KSP2 can be a little frustrating and more tailored toward experienced players.
